intro: Rauvolfia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian rosy periwinkle, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, particularly reserpine, which has been historically used in traditional medicine. Its leaves and roots are often harvested for their medicinal properties. Rauvolfia amazonica thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests.
